p: Data were analyzed by the Statistical Package of the Social Science Statistical software (SPSS) for Window, Version 22.0.0 (IBM SPSS Inc., IL, USA). Descriptive statistics were applied to the prevalence of different viruses found in AECOPD and asthma patients and comparisons with the control subjects were done by chi-square test, Fisher’s exact test and Student t-test as appropriate. Clinical outcomes of the patients with different viruses were compared by chi-square test, Student t-test and Kruskal–Wallis test as appropriate. Figures were presented as mean (SD) or median (interquartile range), and a p-value of < 0.05 was considered as significant.
